cards.flavor: Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.
cards.text: Add 1 card (or up to 2 virus cards) from your heap to your grip.
cards.title: Déjà Vu

cards.flavor: "My little book of magic spells." -The Whizzard
cards.text: +2[mu] Whenever you install a virus program, place 1 virus counter on that program. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Grimoire

cards.text: Djinn can host up to 3[mu] of non-icebreaker programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit. [click], 1[credit]: Search your stack for a virus program, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Djinn

cards.flavor: It looked like random packet loss. It wasn't.
cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Medium.
Each virus counter after the first on Medium allows you to access 1 additional card from R&D whenever you access cards from R&D.
cards.title: Medium

cards.text:
Install Parasite only on a rezzed piece of ice.
Host ice has -1 strength for each virus counter on Parasite and is trashed if its strength is 0 or less.
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Parasite.
cards.title: Parasite

cards.flavor: The Yog.0 database is a crowdsourced compilation of sniffed, spoofed, and logged passkeys. If the key to the gate is in the database, you're in. If it's not, change the gate!
cards.text: 0[credit]: Break code gate subroutine.
cards.title: Yog.0

cards.flavor: "Best place to go when you want to get your mind out of the gutter and take it inside." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
cards.text: When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and lose [click].
cards.title: Wyldside

cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may force the Corp to lose up to 5[credit], then you gain 2[credit] for each credit lost and take 2 tags.
cards.title: Account Siphon

cards.text: +1[mu] Gain 1[credit] whenever you make a successful run. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Desperado

cards.flavor: You feel Ninja before you see Ninja, if you see Ninja at all.
cards.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +5 strength.
cards.title: Ninja

cards.flavor: The Akamatsu company was founded on three principles: first, to make the fastest mem chips on the market, second, to turn a profit, and third, to serve as a front for the manufacture of illegal neural-stimulants. It is the last principle that perhaps explains their rabid brand loyalty.
cards.title: Akamatsu Mem Chip

cards.text: +2[mu] +2[link] 2[recurring-credit] Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: The Toolbox

cards.flavor: He always uses the same key.
cards.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of ZU.13 Key Master is 0, even if it is not installed. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: ZU.13 Key Master

cards.flavor: "What causes an Artifical Intellegence to turn on its master? Is it because its directives have been altered by some external source? Or, by giving them agency to adapt, have we fated them to revolt?" -Emilio Harris, Creators and the Created
cards.text: +1[link] [trash]: Choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +2 strength until the end of the turn.
cards.title: The Helpful AI

cards.text: Place 4 power counters on Plascrete Carapace when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Plascrete Carapace, trash it. Hosted power counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.
cards.title: Plascrete Carapace

cards.flavor: There was a certain schadenfreude about throwing away your credits.
cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may pay X[credit] to force the Corp to lose up to X[credit], then take 1 tag.
cards.title: Vamp

cards.flavor: CyberSolutions' e3 line of implants trade strictly in muscle memory and automatic responses, freeing the brain to focus entirely on cerebral tasks.
cards.text:
Whenever you break a subroutine on a piece of ice, you may pay 1[credit] to break 1 subroutine on that ice.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.0.1</errata>
cards.title: e3 Feedback Implants

cards.flavor: "If your snowball gets big enough, you can make it into a snowman!" -Chaos Theory
cards.text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. Whenever you use Snowball to break a subroutine, it has +1 strength for the remainder of the run.
cards.title: Snowball

cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Nerve Agent.
Each virus counter after the first on Nerve Agent allows you to access 1 additional card from HQ whenever you access cards from HQ.
cards.title: Nerve Agent

cards.flavor: "My enhancements are guaranteed for life, and well worth the risk."
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may gain [click]. If you do, take 1 tag when this turn ends.
cards.title: Joshua B.

cards.flavor: "A snitch is a girl's best friend." -Andromeda
cards.text: Once per run, you may expose an unrezzed piece of ice when you approach it. You may then jack out.
cards.title: Snitch

cards.text:
[click]: Host a program or piece of hardware from your grip on Personal Workshop and place power counters on it equal to its install cost.
1[credit]: Remove 1 power counter from a hosted card.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from a hosted card.
When there are no power counters left on a hosted card, install it, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: Personal Workshop

cards.flavor: Cyberspace's strongest glue.
cards.text: [trash]: Derez a piece of ice. Use this ability only after breaking all the subroutines of that ice during a single encounter.
cards.title: Crescentus

cards.flavor: You must yell "surge" to get the full effect.
cards.text:
Play only if you placed at least 1 virus counter on a program this turn.
Place 2 virus counters on that program.
cards.title: Surge

cards.flavor: She at her P.A.D. I at my rig. Low lights. Smooth jazz. Love blooms.
cards.text: Draw 5 cards.
cards.title: Quality Time

cards.flavor: Do you really need another one?
cards.text: Whenever you install a piece of hardware (including Replicator), you may search your stack for another copy of that hardware, reveal it, and add it your grip. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Replicator

cards.flavor:
"The itsy bitsy spider went up the data spout…"
-Chaos Theory
cards.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Creeper is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Creeper

cards.flavor: "You aren't the only type of runner in New Angeles."
cards.text:
You cannot use Kati Jones more than once per turn.
[click]: Place 3[credit] from the bank on Kati Jones.
[click]: Take all credits from Kati Jones.
cards.title: Kati Jones

cards.flavor: A two-way solution to a one-way problem, the data leak reversal, or DLR for short, is a misnomer. There is no actual reversal of data, only the creation of a parallel peer-to-peer link with the initial source.
cards.text:
Install only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
If you are tagged, Data Leak Reversal gains "[click]: The Corp trashes the top card of R&D."
cards.title: Data Leak Reversal

cards.flavor: Works best at your own desk.
cards.text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, access 1 additional card from R&D.
cards.title: R&D Interface

cards.flavor: "New Angeles is the jewel of modern civilization, and its government the envy of nations." -Mayor Wells
cards.text:
2[credit]: Avoid 1 tag.
Trash New Angeles City Hall when you steal an agenda.
cards.title: New Angeles City Hall

cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers (without rezzing or derezzing the ice). The same number of ice must be protecting each server after the rearrangement as before.
cards.title: Escher

cards.flavor: "Idealism's great, but it don't keep you in soybeef tacos." -Matt "TheMerc" Thomas
cards.text: Trash up to 5 programs from your grip. Gain 2[credit] for each program trashed.
cards.title: Freelance Coding Contract

cards.flavor: One man's trash.
cards.text:
Trash an installed program.
If you do, install a program from your grip or heap, lowering the install cost of that program by the cost of the program trashed.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
cards.title: Scavenge

cards.flavor: Spend too much time in the AR Lab and someone might notice. Unless you're the head of it, that is.
cards.text: Shuffle your grip and heap into your stack. Draw 5 cards. Remove Levy AR Lab Access from the game instead of trashing it.
cards.title: Levy AR Lab Access

cards.flavor: It still hurts, a bit, the first time. The second time, you feel nothing at all. But don't push your luck.
cards.text:
3[credit]: Prevent 1 net damage.
[trash]: Prevent up to 2 brain damage.
cards.title: Feedback Filter

cards.flavor: It is good practice to backup the backup.
cards.text: [trash]: Install a program from your heap (paying the install cost).
cards.title: Clone Chip

cards.text:
Omni-drive can host a single program of 1[mu] or less. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to pay for using the hosted program.
cards.title: Omni-drive

cards.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Cyber-Cypher, choose a server. Cyber-Cypher can only be used during a run on the chosen server.
cards.title: Cyber-Cypher

cards.flavor: Perfect for flooding servers.
cards.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash assets.
cards.title: Paricia

cards.flavor: "Make sure you tell the source code which executable you want it to compile into. One time I left my rig for a couple of minutes, and when I came back all of my files had been replaced with cat vids." -The Professor
cards.text: 2[credit], [trash]: Search your stack for a program and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Self-modifying Code

cards.flavor: "The Incans believed that the sun god resided in the Haman Pacha, the upper realm of the cosmos. They just didn't know that the Haman Pacha hadn't been discovered yet." -The Professor
cards.text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Inti

cards.flavor: Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig is, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.
cards.text: [click]: Gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.
cards.title: Professional Contacts

cards.flavor: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner…
cards.text: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5[credit] if it was successful.
cards.title: Dirty Laundry

cards.flavor: "We say 'cyber-terrorist', they hear 'underground celebrity.'" -Michael Muhama, professional expert.
cards.text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Daily Casts when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Daily Casts, trash it.
Take 2[credit] from Daily Casts when your turn begins.
cards.title: Daily Casts

cards.flavor: Just me, a cup of YucaBean, and last night's Hong Kong Trunk sniffed packets. I call that a good morning.
cards.text: [click], [click], [trash]: Play an event from your heap (paying its play cost).
cards.title: Same Old Thing

cards.flavor: A dangerous game, but well worth playing.
cards.text:
The advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, you must pay 3[credit].
Trash The Source when an agenda is scored or stolen.
cards.title: The Source

cards.text: [click]: Host Rook on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Rook can be hosted only on ice protecting this server or on ice in the same position (counting from the innermost spot) protecting another server. The rez cost of each piece of ice protecting this server is increased by 2.
cards.title: Rook

cards.text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Hostage

cards.flavor: Simple in principle, a drip virus drains fractions of currency from their accounts into yours.
cards.text:
Whenever the Corp spends a [click] to draw 1 card or gain 1[credit] (not through a card ability), place 1 virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
[click], [trash]: Gain 1[credit] for each virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
cards.title: Gorman Drip v1

cards.flavor: "What if this ice wants to be free?" -Rielle "Kit" Peddler
cards.text: Whenever you pass a piece of unrezzed ice, you may trash False Echo. If you do, the Corp must rez that ice or add it to HQ.
cards.title: False Echo

cards.flavor: Normal people-sane people-do not embark on a life of cybercrime. Who can say what motivates the deranged mind? An imagined slight, personal failings blamed on external forces, or the ever-popular lust for money? -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of your stack.
cards.title: Motivation

cards.flavor: "I've been logging online with babes all day. Don't worry, the connections are clean. I guarantee it."
cards.text:
The first time you make a successful run each turn, draw 1 card.
The first time you make an unsuccessful run each turn, take 1 tag.
cards.title: John Masanori

cards.flavor: Installing 1001 programs puts you in the hacker hall of fame, or would if such an institution actually existed.
cards.text:
Scheherazade can host any number of programs.
Whenever you install a program on Scheherazade, gain 1[credit].
cards.title: Scheherazade

cards.flavor: A VoicePAD is a personal access device with most of its functions ripped out. Just about all it's good for is making voice-calls and managing your contacts. The only reason to even have one is for its anonymity, which for a certain kind of person is all the reason one needs.
cards.text:
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to play events.
cards.title: Prepaid VoicePAD

cards.flavor: 'Maneuver warfare' is a doctrine that advocates keeping an enemy off-balance. It works just as well in cyberspace as in reality.
cards.text: 2[credit]: Break subroutine on host ice. [click]: Host Knight on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Knight can be hosted only on ice that is not installed directly before or after the current piece of ice hosting Knight.
cards.title: Knight

cards.flavor: The core of the grid. A blinding sphere of light, teeming with energy, crackling with flame. Beyond were only twinkling bits of data in a field of darkness. No hacker dared approach the core, except one. He came back with a flare of code, a torch that burned with the fire of the core itself. The dark places of cyberspace were dark no more, and the legend of g00ru was born.
cards.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Torch

cards.flavor: The instructions claim that it sifts the most important data. 'Important', it has been found, is a highly relative term.
cards.text:
[click]: Run R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, look at the top 3 cards of R&D. Trash 1 of those cards, then the Corp shuffles R&D.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
cards.title: Keyhole

cards.flavor: The first credited icebreaker was nothing more than a unique script to bypass the security calls on a Gibson 3 Data Sentry. Garrote has over 20,000 times the data as that first breaker, but the idea remains the same: cut off the power source from the network, and then smash on through.
cards.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Garrote

cards.flavor: "One-shot icebreakers are popular among many of my protégés. They don't have the patience for the hunt." -The Professor
cards.text: [trash]: Break any number of destroyer subroutines. 1[credit]: +2 strength.
cards.title: Sharpshooter

cards.flavor:
That moment of bliss. That feeling of accomplishment. That certainty of purpose.
What's next?
cards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Access 1 installed card (non-ice).
cards.title: Quest Completed

cards.flavor: "CyberSolutions is a boring name for a company that makes pretty exciting products. Their memory chips have some pretty tricky stuff going on inside and I keep hearing good things about their M/MI implants. I even heard they were on the path to their own androids about a year ago. I wonder whatever happened with that?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
cards.title: CyberSolutions Mem Chip

cards.text:
Play only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
Make a run. The Corp cannot rez ice for the duration of this run.
cards.title: Blackmail

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Place up to 3 advancement tokens on an unrezzed card in a remote server. Gain 2[credit] for each advancement token placed. You cannot access that card this turn.
cards.title: Queen's Gambit

cards.flavor: "Hand-made code is like hand-made art. You can see the brush strokes, which lets you see the artist. And then you can see everything in a new way." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
cards.text: [click]: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate or barrier until the end of the next run this turn.
cards.title: Paintbrush

cards.flavor: Data hunters always pay top dollar for old drives. The more useless the data, the higher the payout.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Gain 9[credit].
cards.title: Lucky Find

cards.flavor: A job is only as strong as the weakest link. Thankfully Ms. Jones is always on time.
cards.text: Gain 1[credit] for each installed connection resource.
cards.title: Calling in Favors

cards.flavor: The clone was surprised to see the red-jacketed man. It was like looking in a mirror, only the mirror made him look…cool. Confident. Individual.
cards.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your stack and add 1 of those cards to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Express Delivery

cards.flavor: "I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette
cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards from HQ.
cards.title: Legwork

cards.text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Search your stack for a run event and play that run event (paying its play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Planned Assault

cards.text: +1[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1. Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, you may search your stack for a card and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Logos

cards.text: 2[credit]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +4 strength. Breach cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
cards.title: Breach

cards.flavor: Catch me if you can!
cards.text: 1[credit]: Break tracer subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
cards.title: Gingerbread

cards.flavor: If speed is of the essence, an indirect encounter with a piece of ice is usually best.
cards.text: [trash]: Break all but 1 subroutine on a piece of ice.
cards.title: Grappling Hook

cards.flavor: She was as good as Mr. Li said. The source machine had been compromised in under 24 hours. If a freelance operative could do that, the server clearly wasn't ready to endure Gagarin's legion of corp-owned runners.
cards.text:
When your turn begins, you may choose a server. The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, gain 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
cards.title: Security Testing

cards.flavor:
She slipped back onto her hopper. "I'm your family now, so don't twist me, dǒng ma?"
He flicked the e-cig away from his mouth, and nodded. What had he gotten himself into?
cards.text:
You cannot use Tri-maf Contact more than once per turn.
[click]: Gain 2[credit].
When Tri-maf Contact is trashed, suffer 3 meat damage.
cards.title: Tri-maf Contact

cards.text: Place 1 power counter on Overmind when it is installed for each unused MU. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Overmind

cards.flavor: "The best place to hide is in plain sight, don't you think?"
cards.text:
You cannot use Oracle May more than once per turn.
[click]: Name a card type. Reveal the top card of your stack. If the revealed card is of the named type, draw it and gain 2[credit]. Otherwise, trash it.
cards.title: Oracle May

cards.flavor: "Public network kiosks, vending machines-there's all sorts of poorly-secured power sources in the city. Tap in to one of these and you've got plenty of juice when you need it. A little advance warning when the power grid starts misbehaving, too." -Gabriel Santiago
cards.text: Gain 1[credit] whenever a trace is initiated.
cards.title: Power Tap

cards.flavor: "I once saw someone running a seven-tier nested daemon tree. Not for any good reason, just to see if he could. Well, of course the root daemon crashed and he lost everything. I wonder what he's up to now?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
cards.text: Leprechaun can host up to 2 programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit.
cards.title: Leprechaun

cards.flavor: Sometimes a single stone is enough.
cards.text: Place 3 power counters on D4v1d when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has a strength of 5 or greater.
cards.title: D4v1d

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first piece of ice encountered each turn has -2 strength for the remainder of the run.
cards.title: Scrubbed

cards.flavor: What goes up must always go down.
cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp cannot install more than 1 piece of ice each turn.
cards.title: Unscheduled Maintenance

cards.flavor: "People keep saying that 'Cash is king' in the business, like it's untraceable in the days of DNA sniffers and microtracers. Digital credits can be just as anonymous, and they're just as easy to counterfeit." -Silhouette
cards.text: Place 3 virus counters on Cache when it is installed. Hosted virus counter: Gain 1[credit].
cards.title: Cache

cards.flavor: Fifteen seconds of fame.
cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit during a run.
cards.title: Net Celebrity

cards.text: +2[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 2. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Box-E

cards.flavor: "I can get you anything, and guarantee the best prices in town."
cards.text:
[click]: Host a resource or piece of hardware from your grip on The Supplier.
When your turn begins, you may install a hosted card, lowering the install cost by 2.
cards.title: The Supplier

cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards, you may install Hades Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[trash]: Access all cards in Archives.
Limit 1 per deck.
cards.title: Hades Shard

cards.flavor: "Knowledge comes in many different shapes and sizes." -Quetzal
cards.text: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack and trash all programs revealed. Gain 1[credit] for each program trashed, and add the rest of the revealed cards to your grip.
cards.title: Inject

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed piece of hardware.
Gain credits equal to half the install cost of the trashed hardware (rounded down) and search your stack for a piece of hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Trade-In

cards.flavor: "There is no better tool for charting the empty spaces of the net." -Nasir Meidan
cards.text: +1[mu] Draw 1 card whenever the Corp creates a server. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Astrolabe

cards.flavor: "He only likes to eat live meat." -MaxX
cards.text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3

cards.flavor: "Useful for fetching all sorts of things…but you better have a treat ready if he likes it." -Iain Stirling
cards.text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Rex" H2 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Cerberus "Rex" H2

cards.flavor: "Its bytes are definitely worse than its bark." -Chaos Theory
cards.text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Lady" H1 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Cerberus "Lady" H1

cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, instead of accessing cards, you may install Utopia Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[trash]: The Corp discards 2 cards from HQ at random.
Limit 1 per deck.
cards.title: Utopia Shard

cards.flavor: "What terrors hatch in her dispossessed mind, waiting for their moment to be born? My money's on a double-helix rainbow with the head of a panda." -fakespeare
cards.text: When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Incubator. [click], [trash]: Move all virus counters from Incubator to another installed virus program.
cards.title: Incubator

cards.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may search your stack for a program and install it, lowering the install cost by 3 for each piece of ice protecting R&D, and then take 1 tag. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Code Siphon

cards.flavor: δὶς ἐς τὸν αὐτὸν ποταμὸν οὐκ ἂν ἐμβαίης
cards.text: Sage has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[credit]: Break code gate or barrier subroutine.
cards.title: Sage

cards.flavor: The datastream slipped away, and it felt like being born for a second time, if only you could remember the first. A rush of air fills the lungs to bursting, and you gasp it out, coughing and choking as the dim lights of the room shine with the brilliance of a thousand suns.
cards.text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you jack out.
cards.title: Au Revoir

cards.text:
Place 3 power counters on Earthrise Hotel when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Earthrise Hotel, trash it.
When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and remove 1 power counter from Earthrise Hotel.
cards.title: Earthrise Hotel

cards.flavor: "The human brain only uses like a quarter of its capacity anyway, right?" -MaxX
cards.text: Gain [click][click][click] and suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented).
cards.title: Amped Up

cards.text:
Draw 3 cards.
Whenever I've Had Worse is trashed by taking net or meat damage, draw 3 cards.
cards.title: I've Had Worse

cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may spend any number of [click] to force the Corp to trash an equal number of cards from HQ at random.
cards.title: Wanton Destruction

cards.flavor: "Hello thank you for vidding MegaBuy I'm Carol how can I help you."
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click][click][click].
Gain 10[credit].
cards.title: Day Job

cards.text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a sentry during this run, trash that sentry.
cards.title: Forked

cards.text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a barrier during this run, trash that barrier.
cards.title: Knifed

cards.text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a code gate during this run, trash that code gate.
cards.title: Spooned

cards.flavor: Nom nom nom.
cards.text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine. You cannot access more than 0 cards for the remainder of this run.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Eater

cards.flavor: "Once your sniffer finds the protocols the server uses to trash its own data, you can spoof those same protocols. It's quite the show." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
cards.text: Whenever an installed Corp card is trashed, place 1 virus counter on Gravedigger. [click], hosted virus counter: The Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
cards.title: Gravedigger

cards.flavor: "We built the network. But then the network evolved. Can we be sure that it is not alive?" -g00ru
cards.text: Place 1 virus counter on Hivemind when it is installed. Virus counters on Hivemind are considered to be hosted on all other virus programs for the purposes of card effects (and can be spent as if on them).
cards.title: Hivemind

cards.text: You may host a single virus program on Progenitor. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit. Whenever virus counters are purged, instead of removing all virus counters from the hosted card, remove all but 1 virus counter from the hosted card. Errata from FAQ 4.0
cards.title: Progenitor

cards.flavor: A black box that makes data disappear forever.
cards.text: Whenever you access cards in Archives, you may remove 1 card in Archives from the game, instead of accessing it.
cards.title: Archives Interface

cards.flavor: There was a sickly smell coming from his closet. He hoped it was only a mouse this time.
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards. If you do, draw 1 card or remove 1 tag.
cards.title: Chop Bot 3000

cards.flavor: "Show me your faith without deeds, if you can."
cards.text: +1[mu] When your turn begins, draw 1 card if the Corp has cards in HQ equal to his or her maximum hand size. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Vigil

cards.flavor: Her eyes were the color of dreams and disasters.
cards.text: When your turn begins, if there are 2 or more power counters on Stim Dealer, remove all power counters from it and suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented); otherwise, place 1 power counter on Stim Dealer and gain [click].
cards.title: Stim Dealer

cards.flavor: Scraps of code drifting around the network can congeal into pools of data. Within this primordial soup the code breaks, re-assemble, mutates. Evolves.
cards.text:
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground.
[click]: Move 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground to another card with at least 1 virus counter on it.
cards.title: Virus Breeding Ground

cards.flavor: "Sometimes I like to make origami cranes out of old newsrag. It helps me think, putting it back on the subconscious. I figure it's the same principle for my rig - keep it busy and it makes me a few creds for my trouble." -Quetzal
cards.text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have 2 or more unused MU.
cards.title: Data Folding

cards.text:
The Corp cannot score an agenda on the same turn he or she installed it.
Trash Clot if the Corp purges virus counters.
cards.title: Clot

cards.flavor: Turns a night owl into an early bird!
cards.text: The first time you lose [click] each turn, gain [click].
cards.title: Adjusted Chronotype

cards.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Spike is 0, even if it is not installed. Spike has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [trash]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines.
cards.title: Spike

cards.flavor: Born for success!
cards.text: The first time you spend [click] to draw 1 card (not through a card ability) each turn, gain 1[credit].
cards.title: Symmetrical Visage

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. As an additional cost to rez non-ice cards, the Corp must randomly trash a card from HQ.
cards.title: Hacktivist Meeting

cards.flavor: Usually crashing with friends means sleeping on the couch. This time, it meant sleeping on a server farm.
cards.text: Off-Campus Apartment can host any number of connections. Whenever you install a connection on Off-Campus Apartment, draw 1 card.
cards.title: Off-Campus Apartment

cards.flavor: "You can help Jinteki shape the future. Your future."
cards.text: Install a resource from your grip, lowering the install cost by 3.
cards.title: Career Fair

cards.text: Place 4 power counters on Dorm Computer when you install it. [click], hosted power counter: Make a run. Avoid all tags for the remainder of the run.
cards.title: Dorm Computer

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
If you have fewer cards in your grip than your maximum hand size, draw cards until you have cards in your grip equal to your maximum hand size.
cards.title: Game Day

cards.text: +1[mu] The first time you play an event each turn, you may play another event (without spending a click) after the first one resolves. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Comet

cards.flavor: "Once you download the lecture source files, this program does a statistical analysis and distills the most important concepts." -Hayley Kaplan
cards.text: Study Guide has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: Place 1 power counter on Study Guide.
cards.title: Study Guide

cards.text: +1[mu] Whenever you steal an agenda, you may swap that agenda with an agenda in the Corp's score area. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Turntable

cards.text:
When you install Titanium Ribs, suffer 2 meat damage.
You choose the card(s) from your grip to trash whenever you take damage (including the damage taken by installing Titanium Ribs).
cards.title: Titanium Ribs

cards.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Crowbar is 0, even if it is not installed. Crowbar has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [trash]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines.
cards.title: Crowbar

cards.text: When you install Net-Ready Eyes, suffer 2 meat damage. Whenever you initiate a run, choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +1 strength for the remainder of the run.
cards.title: Net-Ready Eyes

cards.flavor: The server was quiet that night. I closed my eyes, the low-hum of the datastream lulling me into a trance. When I opened them, the construct stood before me in the shape of a man, clad in light of many colors. His stature was impressive, and his saccharine voice wormed its way into my very soul.
cards.text: Trash a card from your grip: Break ice subroutine. Trash a card from your grip: +2 strength.
cards.title: Faust

cards.flavor: "Whaddya buyin'?"
cards.text:
When you install Street Peddler, host the top 3 cards of your stack facedown on Street Peddler (you may look at these cards at any time).
[trash]: Install 1 card hosted on Street Peddler, lowering its install cost by 1.
cards.title: Street Peddler

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Expose 1 card installed in a remote server. Trash that card at no cost if it is an asset or upgrade.
cards.title: Drive By

cards.flavor: Using the exact same rig as a million other people is just another form of security through anonymity.
cards.text: +1[link] [trash]: Avoid or remove 1 tag. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Forger

cards.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Shiv is 0, even if it is not installed. Shiv has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [trash]: Break up to 3 sentry subroutines.
cards.title: Shiv

cards.flavor: Muertos has no fear of the law. Muertos is the law.
cards.text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, access 1 card from HQ.
cards.title: Gang Sign

cards.flavor: "It doesn't actually bend time. It just feels like it. That's relativity." -Hayley Kaplan
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may remove Hyperdriver from the game and gain [click][click][click].
cards.title: Hyperdriver

cards.flavor: "Did you ever notice how everything goes in cycles? The stuff that's cool now was cool before. That's why I keep copy of everything!" -Princess Space Kitten
cards.text: When your turn begins, place 1 power counter on Trope. [click], remove Trope from the game: Shuffle 1 card from your heap into your stack for each power counter on Trope.
cards.title: Trope

cards.flavor: "Just a bunch of knockoffs for the touristos. The real designer stuff isn't sold on the street."
cards.text:
When your turn begins, lose 1[credit].
When the Corp's turn begins, draw 1 card.
cards.title: Drug Dealer

cards.flavor: Your life is not your own, once you become famous on the Net.
cards.text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, add Fan Site to your score area as an agenda worth 0 agenda points.
cards.title: Fan Site

cards.flavor: "My gerbil could write a better screenplay."
cards.text:
Film Critic can host a single agenda.
Whenever you access an agenda, you may host that agenda on Film Critic (the agenda is no longer being accessed and is uninstalled).
[click],[click]: Add an agenda hosted on Film Critic to your score area.
cards.title: Film Critic

cards.flavor: "Yeah, we know right where she is. Just pull up Sizzler!"
cards.text:
You are tagged.
Prevent all meat damage.
cards.title: Paparazzi

cards.flavor: Cowabunga, dude!
cards.text: 2[credit]: Swap a piece of barrier ice currently being encountered with a piece of ice directly before or after it. The run continues from this new position. You are still encountering that ice.
cards.title: Surfer

cards.flavor: "First, you get a horde of zombies. Then you do whatever you want, 'cuz you have a horde of zombies." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
cards.text: [trash]: The Corp cannot rez the outermost piece of ice during a run on any server this turn.
cards.title: DDoS

cards.flavor: "The secret to investing is networking." -Laramy Fisk
cards.text:
Play only as your first [click].
Each player draws 3 cards.
cards.title: Fisk Investment Seminar

cards.text:
[click]: Host up to 3 cards from your grip facedown on Bookmark (you may look at these cards at any time).
[click] or [trash]: Add all cards on Bookmark to your grip.
cards.title: Bookmark

cards.flavor: "Our life is made by the death of others." -Leonardo Da Vinci
cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 power counter on DaVinci.
[trash]: Install a card from your grip with an install cost equal to or less than the number of power counters on DaVinci, ignoring the install cost.
cards.title: DaVinci

cards.flavor: Almost a zettabyte of data flows each minute through one of the many net pavilions scattered around the expo.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to spend [click] to trash a resource (not through a card ability), the Corp must pay 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.0.1</errata>
cards.title: Wireless Net Pavilion

cards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ, R&D and Archives this turn.
Trash all installed Corp cards. Turn all installed Runner cards facedown.
cards.title: Apocalypse

cards.flavor: "Meantime the hellish tattoo of the heart increased. It grew quicker and quicker, and louder and louder every instant." -Edgar Allan Poe
cards.text: +1[mu] Trash an installed card: Prevent 1 damage. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Heartbeat

cards.text: When Harbinger is trashed, install it facedown instead of adding it to your heap.
cards.title: Harbinger

cards.flavor: "There's parts of the Network now that are different from how they used to be. I can't put my finger on it; just something twitching at my ganglion through my BMI." -Reeve
cards.text:
Once per turn, prevent a "when encountered" ability on a piece of ice.
[trash]: Install the top 3 cards of your stack facedown.
cards.title: Hunting Grounds

cards.flavor: Data goes in. Nothing comes out.
cards.text: The first time each turn you trash 1 of your installed cards, gain 1[credit].
cards.title: Wasteland

cards.flavor: Adam raised the hammer. He was free.
cards.text: Trash up to 5 of your installed cards. Draw 1 card for each card trashed (or 2 cards for each card trashed if you trashed at least 1 directive).
cards.title: Independent Thinking

cards.text: +X[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by X. X is equal to the number of agenda points you have. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Brain Chip

cards.flavor: Bioroids have two brains running in parallel, each capable of running sophisticated programming. There are certain advantages to the setup.
cards.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for using programs.
cards.title: Multithreader

cards.flavor: The Second Directive requires a bioroid to complete its primary function above all other considerations, save the First Directive.
cards.text: Your first [click] each turn must be spent to make a run or play a run event. Once per turn, you can spend [click][click] to break a subroutine on a piece of ice currently being encountered.
cards.title: Always Be Running

cards.flavor: "You look tore up, kid. Have a seat, I'll fire up the arc welder."
cards.text: When your turn begins, choose one of your installed cards. The text box of that card is blank for the remainder of the turn.
cards.title: Dr. Lovegood

cards.flavor: The Third Directive requires a bioroid to preserve its ability to function and report frequently to Haas-Bioroid for repairs and updates.
cards.text:
The first time each turn you access a card with a trash cost, reveal it. You must trash that card by paying its trash cost, if able.
Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
cards.title: Neutralize All Threats

cards.flavor: The First Directive forbids a bioroid from harming, or through inaction allowing harm to befall, a human being.
cards.text:
Your maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
When your turn ends, draw 1 card if you do not have cards in your grip equal to or greater than your maximum hand size.
cards.title: Safety First

cards.text: +1[mu] +1[link] Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may force the Corp to "trace 5 If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and end the run. If unsuccessful, the Runner bypasses the currently encountered ice." Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Security Nexus

cards.flavor: Bigger.
cards.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of GS Striker M1 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break any number of code gate subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
cards.title: GS Striker M1

cards.flavor: Badder.
cards.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of GS Shrike M2 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
cards.title: GS Shrike M2

cards.flavor: Boom.
cards.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of GS Sherman M3 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break any number of barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
cards.title: GS Sherman M3

cards.flavor: "I got an early start today...or maybe I forgot to go home last night."
cards.text:
Reduce the cost to install Jak Sinclair by 1 for each [link] you have.
When your turn begins, you may make a run. You cannot use programs during this run.
cards.title: Jak Sinclair

cards.flavor: "Are you crazy? We can't send in prisec until the media gets bored and goes home."
cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp's identity text box is blank.
cards.title: Employee Strike

cards.flavor: Technically correct: the best kind of correct.
cards.text:
Whenever you install a piece of hardware or a program, place 1[credit] from the bank on Technical Writer.
[click],[trash]: Take all credits from Technical Writer.
cards.title: Technical Writer

cards.flavor: "While there have been other anti-corporation movements before, like the Maroon Wave, this new one is different. It's organized." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy
cards.text: Make a run. When the run ends, trash 1 piece of ice that was rezzed during this run.
cards.title: Run Amok

cards.text: Make a run on a server with at least 1 piece of unrezzed ice. When the run ends, gain 12[credit] if it was successful.
cards.title: High-Stakes Job

cards.flavor: It is the hardest thing in the world to frighten a mongoose, because he is eaten up from nose to tail with curiosity. The motto of all the mongoose family is "Run and find out". -Rudyard Kipling, Rikki-Tikki-Tavi
cards.text: You cannot use Mongoose to break subroutines on more than one ice per run. 1[credit]: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 2[credit]: +2 strength.
cards.title: Mongoose

cards.flavor: "The basics should be like the stories you learned as a child—unconscious, never forgotten, and suddenly relevant at the most random times." -g00ru
cards.text: Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may have it gain 1 subtype of your choice that is not sentry, code gate, or barrier for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Panchatantra

cards.flavor: "We can forgive a man for making a useful thing as long as he does not admire it. The only excuse for making a useless thing is that one admires it intensely." -Oscar Wilde
cards.text: Forfeit an agenda: Search your stack for a card and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Artist Colony

cards.flavor: "Why would you dispose of perfectly good evidence when you can sell it?"
cards.text: Whenever you use a [trash] ability, gain 1[credit].
cards.title: Tech Trader

cards.text:
NetChip can host a program with a memory cost less than or equal to the number of copies of NetChip installed. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
Limit 6 per deck.
cards.title: NetChip

cards.flavor: "We may be outraged, but we're not surprised." -Sunder
cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp has 1 additional bad publicity (even if they have 0).
cards.title: Corporate Scandal

cards.text:
[click]: Look at the top X cards of your stack and arrange them in any order. X is the number of copies of Spy Camera installed.
[trash]: Look at the top card of R&D.
Limit 6 per deck.
cards.title: Spy Camera

cards.flavor: Leverage, secrets, access, and influence are currency as valuable as credits. But credits work, too.
cards.text: Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. [trash], pay the trash cost of a rezzed card: Trash that card.
cards.title: Political Operative

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. When you steal an agenda, add "Freedom Through Equality" to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
cards.title: "Freedom Through Equality"

cards.flavor: "Bureaucracy and red tape have been weaponized." -Fake-ir
cards.text: Whenever the Corp rezzes an asset or upgrade, you may pay credits equal to its rez cost and trash Councilman. If you do, derez that asset or upgrade. The Corp cannot rez it for the remainder of this turn.
cards.title: Councilman

cards.flavor: "Underestimate those people at your own peril." -Akshara Sareen
cards.text:
Once per turn, you may pay the trash cost of a card you access that is not in Archives to remove that card from the game.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>
cards.title: Salsette Slums

cards.flavor: The more parties she attended, the more they trusted her. The more they trusted her, the more entertaining her scams became.
cards.text:
Draw 1 card. Gain 1[credit] for each copy of Exclusive Party in your heap.
Limit 6 per deck.
cards.title: Exclusive Party

cards.text: 1[credit]: Break up to 2 ice subroutines. 2[credit]: +1 strength. Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Brahman to break a subroutine ends, add 1 installed non-virus program to the top of your stack.
cards.title: Brahman

cards.text:
When your turn begins, you may choose a server.
The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, draw 2 cards.
cards.title: Patron

cards.flavor: "Check out my new ride." -2xTiger
cards.text:
+1[link]
[trash]: Draw 3 cards.
cards.title: Sports Hopper

cards.flavor: "Who were you when you realized everything you knew was a lie?"
cards.text:
Switch your identity with another identity from the same faction. Remove Rebirth from the game instead of trashing it.
Limit 1 per deck.
cards.title: Rebirth

cards.text: Whenever a run on HQ or R&D ends, place 1 power counter on The Turning Wheel if you stole no agendas during the run. 2 hosted power counters: For the remainder of this run, access 1 additional card from HQ or R&D.
cards.title: The Turning Wheel

cards.text:
Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, force the Corp to trash the top card of R&D. You may reveal X copies of Fear the Masses from your grip to force the Corp to trash X additional cards.
Limit 6 per deck.
cards.title: Fear the Masses

cards.flavor: "They don't want to listen, so we'll just have to crank up the volume."
cards.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, force the Corp to trash the top card of R&D.
cards.title: Bhagat

cards.text:
The Corp cannot win the game except if you are flatlined.
When your turn begins, place 1 power counter on The Black File. When there are 3 or more power counters on The Black File, remove it from the game.
Limit 1 per deck.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
cards.title: The Black File

cards.text: If you use Ankusa to break all subroutines on a barrier during a single encounter, add that barrier to HQ. 2[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Ankusa

cards.flavor: <champion>Designed by 2014 World Champion Dan D'Argenio</champion>
cards.text:
Resolve two of the following in any order:
  • Gain 3[credit].
  • Draw 2 cards.
  • Remove 1 tag.
  • Expose 1 piece of ice, then make a run.
cards.title: Deuces Wild

cards.flavor: "You can have a lot of fun in 23 seconds." -Princess Space Kitten
cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The text box of each unique non-region asset and upgrade is blank.
cards.title: Rumor Mill

cards.flavor: "It is not wise to call someone crazy until you fully understand what they're trying to say." -Omar Keung
cards.text: Whenever you encounter a barrier, you may install Paperclip from your heap (paying its install cost). X[credit]: +X strength. Break up to X barrier subroutines, if able.
cards.title: Paperclip

cards.flavor: "The best part is, it's legal!" -Khan
cards.text:
Choose a server and place 20[credit] from the bank on Temüjin Contract when you install it. When there are no credits left on Temüjin Contract, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on the chosen server, take 4[credit] from Temüjin Contract.
cards.title: Temüjin Contract

cards.flavor: "Coming to you live from the front lines, for now, unless they kill me..."
cards.text:
If the Corp has 5-9[credit] when your turn begins, gain 1[credit].
If the Corp has 10-14[credit] when your turn begins, draw 1 card.
If the Corp has at least 15[credit] when your turn begins, gain [click].
cards.title: Beth Kilrain-Chang

cards.text: +1[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1 for each tag you have. The first time a successful run on R&D or HQ ends each turn, draw 1 card for each card you accessed during that run. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Obelus

cards.flavor: "In extremity, your conscience may make you terrible." -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint
cards.text: Whenever you encounter a code gate, you may install Black Orchestra from your heap (paying its install cost). 3[credit]: +2 strength. Break up to 2 code gate subroutines, if able.
cards.title: Black Orchestra

cards.flavor: "All bioroids are bound by the Three Directives, but in theory a bioroid could have any number of core directives. Even zero."
cards.text:
Whenever you draw a card, reveal that card.
The first time you make a successful run each turn, you may look at the top card of R&D.
cards.title: Find the Truth

cards.flavor: "When your opponent is weak, strike. If you do not, he will become strong." - the Playbook
cards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run this turn.
Trash an unrezzed piece of ice you passed during the last run you made this turn.
cards.title: En Passant

cards.flavor: Omar goes through four, five keyboards per week, no two from the same decade.
cards.text: Look at the top 10 cards of your stack. If any of those cards are programs, you may install one of them, lowering the install cost by 5. Trash the rest of those cards.
cards.title: Frantic Coding

cards.text: +2[mu] Whenever you access cards from HQ during a run, access 1 additional card for each piece of ice protecting HQ that you broke all subroutines on during this run. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: The Gauntlet

cards.flavor: "I used to run stims, simsensies, the usual. I was scum. Now I run water. I'm a fragging hero."
cards.text: [click],[click]: Draw 3 cards. Shuffle 1 card from your grip into your stack.
cards.title: Blockade Runner

cards.flavor: "I usually find something interesting in there. Just not what I was looking for."
cards.text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, instead of accessing cards, you may choose 1 of the top 5 cards of R&D and access it. You cannot access any other cards in R&D during this run.
cards.title: Top Hat

cards.flavor: "The Starlight Meditation Booths are available to refugees for free for the duration of the crisis."
cards.text: If you are tagged when your turn ends, force the Corp to "Trace 1 If unsuccessful, the Runner removes 1 tag." [trash],trash all cards in your grip: Prevent all meat damage.
cards.title: Citadel Sanctuary

cards.flavor: "These things are always there, under the surface, but no one wants to know the truth." -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint
cards.text: Whenever you encounter a sentry, you may install MKUltra from your heap (paying its install cost). 3[credit]: +2 strength. Break up to 2 sentry subroutines, if able.
cards.title: MKUltra

cards.flavor: "Never, ever, overstay your welcome." -Andromeda
cards.text: Install On the Lam on a resource as a hosted condition counter with the text "[trash]: Avoid up to 3 tags or prevent up to 3 damage."
cards.title: On the Lam

cards.flavor: It is only the illusion of choice.
cards.text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may reveal the top card of R&D. If you do, you may force the Corp to draw that card.
cards.title: Equivocation

cards.flavor: "It's the most fundamental element of illusions and running both. In either case, it should be the first skill you master." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
cards.text: [click], [click], X[credit]: Remove X tags.
cards.title: Misdirection

cards.flavor: "It had been hoped that the Network disruptions surrounding the conflict might also disrupt the phenomenon. Evidently, the reverse is true." -Joséo Greene, SYNC Analyst
cards.text: The first time you trash an installed card each turn, draw 1 card.
cards.title: Reaver

cards.flavor: "She was riding in a great iron mortar and driving it with the pestle, and as she came she swept away her trail behind her with a kitchen broom." -Vasilissa the Beautiful
cards.text: You may host any number of non-AI icebreaker programs on Baba Yaga. Baba Yaga gains the paid abilities of all hosted icebreaker programs.
cards.title: Baba Yaga

cards.text: +2[mu] Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may reduce your maximum hand size by 1 until the beginning of your next turn. If you do, the strength of that ice is lowered to 0 for the remainder of the encounter. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Şifr

cards.text:
Install only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] for every 5[credit] in the Corp's credit pool.
Trash Tapwrm if the Corp purges virus counters.
cards.title: Tapwrm

cards.flavor: "You want to do business in Los Pistoleros turf, then you gotta deal with me."
cards.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, place 2 power counters on Aaron Marrón. Hosted power counter: Remove 1 tag and draw 1 card.
cards.title: Aaron Marrón

cards.text:
Play only as your first [click] and only if the Corp scored no agendas during his or her last turn.
Gain 10[credit]. The Corp gains 5[credit]. You cannot initiate any runs this turn.
cards.title: Peace in Our Time

cards.text: +2[mu] The first time each turn you access a card not in Archives and do not steal or trash it, the Corp must trash 1 card from HQ at random. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Maw

cards.flavor: The Archivist tracks all the clans and their members, and official dealings clans have with the various corps. Half law clerk and half historian, he wields a tremendous amount of power doing a job no one else wants, but none can do without.
cards.text: +1[link] Whenever the Corp scores an initiative or security agenda, force the Corp to "Trace 1 if unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity."
cards.title: The Archivist

cards.text: Make a run. When this run ends, add Mad Dash to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point if you stole at least 1 agenda during the run; otherwise, suffer 1 meat damage.
cards.title: Mad Dash

cards.flavor: "Sure, the implantation was fine, but it pumps Burn. Did you think it wouldn't hurt?"
cards.text:
[click]: Make a run on R&D or HQ and trash 2 or more cards from your grip. Whenever you access cards from that server during this run, access 1 additional card for every 2 cards trashed.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
cards.title: Severnius Stim Implant

cards.flavor: "An eye for an eye? If you're lucky, that's all you'll lose."
cards.text:
Whenever you suffer any amount of damage, place 1 power counter on Clan Vengeance.
[trash]: Trash 1 card from HQ at random for each power counter on Clan Vengeance.
cards.title: Clan Vengeance

cards.flavor: "Who watches the watchers? We do."
cards.text: [click], [trash]: Make a run. If successful, instead of accessing, pay X[credit] to access up to X cards from this server, if able. X is the number of tags you have.
cards.title: Counter Surveillance

cards.flavor: Sometimes efficiency is as easy as offloading routine work to a dedicated handler.
cards.text: Gain 1[credit] and draw 2 cards.
cards.title: Build Script

cards.flavor: "Even I don't know how or why this one works. I just copied the schematics from a burst broadcast from someplace north of Paxton's Node, where nothing is supposed to be." -Los
cards.text: X[credit],[click]: Derez a piece of ice rezzed this turn. X is its printed rez cost. Use this ability once per turn.
cards.title: Rubicon Switch

cards.text: [click], remove an installed program from the game: Search your stack for a non-virus program, shuffle your stack, then install that program, lowering the install cost by the cost of the program removed from the game.
cards.title: Rosetta 2.0

cards.flavor: "Who said you can't teach an old breaker new tricks?" -g00ru
cards.text: Install Adjusted Matrix on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker gains AI and "You may spend [click] to break any subroutine on a piece of ice currently being encountered." Errata from FAQ 4.1
cards.title: Adjusted Matrix

cards.flavor: Better, Faster, Stronger
cards.text: Install Dedicated Processor on a non-AI icebreaker. Host icebreaker gains "2[credit]: +4 strength."
cards.title: Dedicated Processor

cards.text: The first time you pass a piece of ice each turn in which you used Inversificator to break all subroutines, you may swap that ice with another piece of ice. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Inversificator

cards.text: When you install Jarogniew Mercs, take 1 tag. Place 3 power counters on Jarogniew Mercs, and 1 additional power counter for each tag you have. When there are no power counters left on Jarogniew Mercs, trash it. The Corp cannot trash Jarogniew Mercs while there is another resource installed. Hosted power counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.
cards.title: Jarogniew Mercs

cards.flavor: "Taking risks is what makes it fun!" -Kabonesa Wu
cards.text: +2[mu] The first time you initiate a run on a server protected by 2 or more pieces of ice each turn, draw 2 cards. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Daredevil

cards.flavor: "We don't want you! We don't need you!"
cards.text: Play only as your first [click]. Draw 1 card for each installed clan resource. Gain 1[credit] for each tag you have.
cards.title: Mars for Martians

cards.flavor: "Subtle? You don't really understand the point of all of this, do you?" -Alice Merchant
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may take 1 tag to place 2 virus counters on God of War. Hosted virus counter: Break ice subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: God of War

cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, when you would access any number of cards from HQ, you may instead add that many cards from your heap to your grip. Remove Rip Deal from the game instead of trashing it.
cards.title: Rip Deal

cards.text:
Maven has +1 strength for each installed program.
2[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
cards.title: Maven

cards.flavor: "Anyone can hit someone where they are weakest." -S'onge Galaxy
cards.text: During each run, Na'Not'K has +1 strength for each piece of ice protecting the attacked server. 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +2 strength.
cards.title: Na'Not'K

cards.flavor:
"Talk is free. Anything else is going to cost you."
-Jitish
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may remove 1 card in the heap from the game. If you do, gain 2[credit].
cards.title: Bloo Moose

cards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
The Corp must pay 5[credit] or take 1 bad publicity. Remove Mining Accident from the game instead of trashing it.
cards.title: Mining Accident

cards.text:
When you install Respirocytes, suffer 1 meat damage.
The first time you have 0 cards in your grip each turn, draw 1 card and place a power counter on Respirocytes. When Respirocytes has 3 or more power counters on it, trash it.
cards.title: Respirocytes

cards.text:
Whenever you expose a card or access cards and do not steal or trash any of them, place 1 virus counter on Aumakua.
Aumakua has +1 strength for each virus counter on it.
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
cards.title: Aumakua

cards.flavor: The electric pulses ripped through the Net, backtracking Los's location. When they hit his defenses, they spent themselves against the slope.
cards.text: 3[credit]: Prevent 1 net or brain damage.
cards.title: Caldera

cards.flavor: "Aptly named." -g00ru
cards.text: Trash a card from your grip: Prevent an installed card of the same type from being trashed by the Corp.
cards.title: Dummy Box

cards.flavor: He was suddenly very motivated to pass on confidential information.
cards.text: Whenever the Corp spends a [click] to draw a card (not through a card effect), reveal that card.
cards.title: Corporate Defector

cards.flavor: Targeted attacks make system breaches so much easier, especially if you can spoof an authorized user.
cards.text: Make a run. When you encounter the innermost piece of ice protecting that server, bypass it.
cards.title: Spear Phishing

cards.flavor: Flooding the system with synchronized request messages makes it unresponsive to legitimate requests.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
The Corp must either discard 2 cards or draw 4 cards.
cards.title: SYN Attack

cards.flavor: "Never boast. Just let your importance be quietly obvious."
cards.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +5 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of sentry ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Lustig.
cards.title: Lustig

cards.text: Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. When your turn begins, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on Mammon. When your turn ends, remove all hosted power counters.
cards.title: Mammon

cards.flavor: You remember when Maxi was making book for Chacon. He's moved up in the world and gained the veneer of respectability. But as an executive the people he works for now, are far more vicious, bloodthirsty, and crooked.
cards.text:
+1[link]
[trash]: Derez a piece of ice protecting a remote server. Use this ability only during the next paid ability window after a successful run on HQ ends.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.2</errata>.
cards.title: Maxwell James

cards.flavor: Extracting data from complex systems is what running is all about.
cards.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 1 additional card for each unused MU up to 4.
cards.title: Deep Data Mining

cards.flavor: "It is more than just a 'pretty nanite plant'. It's a complex synthetic intelligent distributed network, and a VERY pretty nanite plant." - Bios
cards.text: +1[mu] When your turn begins, draw 1 card. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Ubax

cards.flavor: Μεγάλο μέρος της μάθησης δεν διδάσκει την κατανόηση
cards.text: Adept has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[credit]: Break sentry or barrier subroutine.
cards.title: Adept

cards.flavor: Δεν υπἁρχει τίποτα μόνιμο, εκτός από την αλλαγή.
cards.text: Savant has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[credit]: Break 1 sentry or 2 code gate subroutines.
cards.title: Savant

cards.text: Install Egret only on a rezzed piece of ice. Host ice gains sentry, code gate and barrier.
cards.title: Egret

cards.text:
Dhegdheer can host a single program.
Lower the install cost of programs you install on Dhegdheer by 1.
The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
cards.title: Dhegdheer

cards.flavor: One of the wealthiest and most powerful areas of New Angeles, Laguna Velasco is also known as the Government District.
cards.text: Whenever you spend [click] to draw 1 card (not through a card ability), draw 1 additional card.
cards.title: Laguna Velasco District

cards.flavor: Restructuring labor resources.
cards.text: Gain 2[credit] and draw 1 card.
cards.title: Process Automation

cards.text: [trash], 1[credit]: The Corp trashes 2 cards from HQ at random. Use this ability only if you suffered meat damage this turn.
cards.title: Officer Frank

cards.flavor: Although he rarely teaches classes these days, his lectures are always well attended.
cards.text: [trash]: Choose an icebreaker. Until the end of the run, that icebreaker has +1 strength for each card in your grip.
cards.title: Dean Lister

cards.flavor: She left behind an encrypted trail leading to some random employee for a rival corp. She knew lazy sysops would work just hard enough to figure it out and wouldn't bother looking any deeper.
cards.text: [trash]: Prevent 2 damage.
cards.title: Biometric Spoofing

cards.flavor: A despicable web of outcasts and infamy, no government or corporation could effectively shut it down. If only because so many of their sysops, executives, and covert agents made use of it.
cards.text: [click], forfeit an agenda: Play an event from your heap, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: The Shadow Net

cards.flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?
cards.text:
Run HQ or R&D. During that run, you may pay 0[credit] to trash any card you are accessing (even if it has no trash cost).
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
cards.title: Demolition Run

cards.text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: Retrieval Run

cards.text:
Run a remote server. If successful, instead of accessing cards, trash all cards installed in that server.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
cards.title: Singularity

cards.text: Make a run, and gain 9[credit], which you may use only during this run. After the run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented) and return to the bank any of the 9[credit] not spent.
cards.title: Stimhack

cards.flavor: I feel almost naked without it
cards.text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
cards.title: Cyberfeeder

cards.flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.
cards.text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
cards.title: Hemorrhage

cards.flavor: Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.
cards.text: 1[credit]: Break any number of barrier subroutines.
cards.title: Morning Star

cards.flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corp need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
cards.text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
cards.title: Ice Carver

cards.flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.
cards.text:
Place 16[credit] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from Liberated Account.
cards.title: Liberated Account

cards.flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
cards.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.
cards.title: Scrubber

cards.flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge
cards.text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.
cards.title: Xanadu

cards.flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"
cards.text: Gain 3[credit].
cards.title: Easy Mark

cards.flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda
cards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.
cards.title: Emergency Shutdown

cards.flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.
cards.text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
cards.title: Forged Activation Orders

cards.flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
cards.text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
cards.title: Inside Job

cards.flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
cards.text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Special Order

cards.flavor: Twice the fun.
cards.text: +1[mu] Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Doppelgänger

cards.flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.
cards.text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.
cards.title: HQ Interface

cards.flavor: Show-off.
cards.text: 2[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
cards.title: Peacock

cards.text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.
cards.title: Bank Job

cards.flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection." -Lez "Rockfist" S.
cards.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
cards.title: Crash Space

cards.flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.
cards.text:
[trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit].
cards.title: Fall Guy

cards.flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel…"
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."
cards.text: [click]: Draw 2 cards. Add 1 of these cards to the bottom of your stack.
cards.title: Mr. Li

cards.flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.
cards.title: Diesel

cards.flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.
cards.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
cards.title: Indexing

cards.flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.
cards.text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
cards.title: Modded

cards.flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.
cards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
cards.title: Notoriety

cards.text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.
cards.title: Test Run

cards.flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
cards.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
cards.title: The Maker's Eye

cards.flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."
cards.text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
cards.title: Tinkering

cards.text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Dinosaurus

cards.flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.
cards.text:
+1[link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Rabbit Hole

cards.flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…
cards.text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.
cards.title: The Personal Touch

cards.flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.
cards.text: [click]: Gain 2[credit].
cards.title: Magnum Opus

cards.flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[credit].
cards.title: Aesop's Pawnshop

cards.flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.
cards.text: [trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
cards.title: Sacrificial Construct

cards.flavor: "Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy
cards.text: Gain 2[credit] or expose 1 card.
cards.title: Infiltration

cards.flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.
cards.text: Gain 9[credit].
cards.title: Sure Gamble

cards.flavor: Archaic but reliable.
cards.text: +1[mu], +1[link]
cards.title: Dyson Mem Chip

cards.flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.
cards.text:
Place 12[credit] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Armitage Codebusting.
cards.title: Armitage Codebusting

cards.flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."
cards.text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have at least 2[link].
cards.title: Underworld Contact

cards.text:
Play only as your first [click].
For the remainder of the turn, whenever you access a card not in Archives, trash it and suffer 1 meat damage.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
cards.title: By Any Means

cards.text: Whenever you make a successful run, you may place 1 virus counter on Yusuf. Virus counter from any installed card: Break barrier subroutine. Virus counter from any installed card: +1 strength.
cards.title: Yusuf

cards.flavor: Optical computing still has its uses. But it's hard to explain them to people whose eyes glaze over when you bring up the double-slit experiment.
cards.text:
+1[mu]
The first time you break all subroutines on a piece of ice each turn, you may gain 1[credit].
cards.title: Cyberdelia

cards.flavor: The gap of 0.19 seconds was all he needed.
cards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
Install a card from your grip, lowering its install cost by 8[credit], and take 1 tag.
cards.title: Credit Kiting

cards.flavor: When standard breaking just doesn't cut it.
cards.text: Whenever you break all subroutines on a piece of ice during a single encounter, you may place 1 power counter on Takobi. 2 hosted power counters: Choose a non-AI icebreaker. That icebreaker has +3 strength until the end of the current encounter.
cards.title: Takobi

cards.flavor: A winged terror, the Kongamato dives from above, rending its prey in one ferocious bite.
cards.text: [trash]: Break the first subroutine on the encountered piece of ice.
cards.title: Kongamato

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Trash any number of programs and/or pieces of hardware from your grip. Search your stack for a program or piece of hardware and install it, lowering its install cost by the total install cost of the trashed cards. Shuffle your stack.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.2</errata>
cards.title: Emergent Creativity

cards.flavor: Between nothing and infinity.
cards.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ or R&D each turn, you may name a number. If you do, reveal the next card that you access this run. If it has a rez cost, play cost, or advancement requirement equal to the named number, either gain 3[credit] or draw 2 cards.
cards.title: RNG Key

cards.flavor:
"It makes every bad thing that you do so much better."
- g00ru
cards.text: Whenever you trash a Corp card, you may place 1 virus counter on Friday Chip. When your turn begins, you may move 1 hosted virus counter to a virus program.
cards.title: Friday Chip

cards.flavor: You'd think someone would have noticed a program entitled "Career Opportunities in Hacking" earlier.
